intro: Hieracium pichleri subsp. adamovicii, commonly known as the Adamovici's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to central and eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming basal leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry grasslands and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. It is distinguished by its finely divided leaves and the presence of glandular hairs on its foliage. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
